files.Title: Booseapp.AppArray
files.Summary: Represents an application-defined array variable/command that can store either integer or real values. This class acts as both the "array" declaration command and the stored variable instance in the program.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppAssign
files.Summary: Represents a runtime assignment command that updates an existing variable by evaluating an expression at execution time.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppBoolean
files.Summary: Represents an application-defined boolean variable/command. Inherits from so it can be stored as a variable and used in expressions.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppCall
files.Summary: Represents the call command, which invokes a user-defined method. It evaluates argument expressions, assigns them to the method's parameter variables, stores a return address, and transfers execution to the method body.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppCanvas
files.Summary: Represents a drawable canvas used in the Boose application. Provides methods to draw shapes, set pen properties, and manage drawing state.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppCircle
files.Summary: Represents a command that draws a circle on the canvas. Evaluates the supplied parameter at runtime and uses it as the circle radius.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppCommandFactory
files.Summary: Factory class responsible for creating instances of application-specific commands. Inherits from and overrides the method to return corresponding command objects based on the command name.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppElse
files.Summary: Represents the else part of an if/else block. This is a compound command that links to the corresponding if and the final end.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppEnd
files.Summary: Represents the end marker command used to close compound blocks such as if, else, for, while, and method. During compilation it links the corresponding opening command to its end line. During execution it performs any required control-flow (looping or method return).

files.Title: Booseapp.AppFor
files.Summary: Represents a for loop command. Parses loop syntax, initialises the loop variable, evaluates range/step, and controls program flow until the corresponding end for is reached.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppIf
files.Summary: Represents an if conditional command. Evaluates a boolean expression and controls program flow by jumping to the matching else or end if marker when the condition is false.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppInt
files.Summary: Represents an application-defined integer variable/command. Inherits from so it can be declared, stored, and used in expressions.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppMethod
files.Summary: Represents a user-defined method declaration command. A method defines a return variable, optional typed parameters, and a body that is executed via call. When encountered during normal execution flow, the method body is skipped.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppMoveto
files.Summary: Represents a command that moves the pen to a specified position on the canvas. Inherits from and requires two integer parameters (X and Y coordinates).

files.Title: Booseapp.AppParser
files.Summary: Application-specific parser that extends the BOOSE to support runtime assignment handling and special-case parsing needed by the application.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppPeek
files.Summary: Represents the peek command, which reads a value from an array element and stores it into a destination variable.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppPoke
files.Summary: Represents the poke command, which writes a value into an array element. Supports both integer and real arrays and allows row/column indices to be expressions.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppReal
files.Summary: Represents an application-defined real (double) variable/command. Inherits from so it can be declared, stored, and used in expressions.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppRect
files.Summary: Represents a command that draws a rectangle on the canvas. Inherits from and requires two integer parameters (width and height).

files.Title: Booseapp.AppSet
files.Summary: Represents the set command, which assigns the result of an expression to an existing variable at runtime. Supports integer, real, and boolean variables.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppStoredProgram
files.Summary: Application-specific implementation of . Adds method support (register/call/return) and provides overrides for updating and retrieving application variable types (real/boolean) as well as expression evaluation cleanup.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppWhile
files.Summary: Represents a while loop command. Evaluates a boolean expression and controls program flow by exiting the loop when the condition becomes false.

files.Title: Booseapp.AppWrite
files.Summary: Represents the write command, which evaluates an expression (including string expressions) and writes the resulting text to the canvas.

files.Title: Booseapp.CanvasException
files.Summary: Represents errors that occur during canvas operations such as drawing or rendering. Inherits from the base class.

files.Title: Booseapp.Form1
files.Summary: Represents the main form of the Boose application. Handles initialization, user interactions, and drawing operations on the canvas.

files.Title: Booseapptest.AppArrayTests
files.Summary: Unit tests for array-related commands/behaviour in the BOOSE application layer: verifies correct poke/peek operations for int and real arrays, and validates out-of-bounds access throws the expected exception.

files.Title: Booseapptest.AppBooleanTests
files.Summary: Unit tests for the command/variable handling: verifies boolean variables are created on compile, valid values are set correctly, and invalid boolean assignments are rejected with the expected exception.

files.Title: Booseapptest.AppForTests
files.Summary: Unit tests for the command: verifies initial execution sets the loop variable correctly and that subsequent iterations increment the loop variable as expected.

files.Title: Booseapptest.AppIfTests
files.Summary: Unit tests for the command: verifies that when the IF condition evaluates to true, execution does not jump to the end of the IF block and the condition state is set correctly.

files.Title: Booseapptest.AppIntTests
files.Summary: Unit tests for the command/variable handling: verifies integer variables are created on compile, valid integer values (including negatives) are set correctly, and non-integer values are rejected with the expected exception.

files.Title: Booseapptest.AppMethodTests
files.Summary: Unit tests for BOOSE method support (definition/parsing/compilation): verifies that a method definition compiles successfully, creates the expected return and parameter variables, and (optionally) that the method is registered within the program/method registry.

files.Title: Booseapptest.AppRealTests
files.Summary: Unit tests for the command/variable handling: verifies real variables are created on compile, numeric values are stored correctly (including integers assigned to reals), and non-numeric assignments are rejected.

files.Title: Booseapptest.AppWhileTests
files.Summary: Unit tests for the command: verifies that when the WHILE condition evaluates to true, execution does not jump to the end of the loop and the condition state is set correctly.

files.Title: Booseapptest.Test1
files.Summary: Contains unit tests for verifying the functionality of the class, including MoveTo, DrawTo, and multi-line program behavior.
